instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message:
This board is not liquid damaged

I have seen 4 3332 that show these same symptoms most liquid damage but this one isnt.  

PPBUS G3H is 12.4v
3v42 is 3.42
3.3v S5 is 3.3v
Computer will boot in SMC Bypass with no issue

Has no PM SLP S5 3.3v when charger is plugged in. Reballed SMC and checked pull down resistor for the SLP S5 line. All fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message:
Seems bad smc. Replace it. Reball will not solve the problem.
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is ok?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message:
Replaced SMC from Donor board same issue

IDK if its related or if SLP S5 is needed before this but the 3v3 and 5v SUS rails are 0v. Missing SUS EN line

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message: Is <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present? What is the resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message: Well currently I have managed to go backwards. I now have 5v on G3H so trying to figure that out now. ISL current sense resistors read fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message: Ok replaced ISL back to 12.4v on G3H

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is present 3.3v
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 0.492Kohms resistance to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message:
PPbus seems low at 12.40V
Check sda and scl if 3.3V are presents. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message: So it still powers on in SMC bypass mode now? Are you sure you are using a REAL GENUINE 85W charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message:
duke I love you. Evidently my old 85w is taking a shit and thats why it worked intermittently.
Got a new one to test with today and it boots up. Hopefully not a coincidence and it was the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message: Is the 15" dependent on the extra current available to boot or is it a signal line coming from the brick? It might just need a new cable end if its a signal issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing PM SLP S5
threads.message: The magsafe tip has a one-wire EEPROM in it. The system needs to see a valid charger before it will power on. So you just need an 85W charger and all macbook will power on from that.
